result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Ardie J Thomas in court with attorney Erin Joy Larsen.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Pl to all charges in 16CF479; 15CF1360 & 14CF285 are DRI. In 15CF173, the State moves to dismiss with the agreement not to prosecute. The State agrees to follow the PSI.
P-NC to all
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

BTC: guilty as above. PSI ordered

From Defendant.

Defendant Ardie J Thomas in court with attorney Erin Joy (Larsen) Preston.  Defendant Ardie J Thomas in custody.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Defense is asking that bond be converted back to the original amounts - argument put on the record. The State is concerned that 16CF479, deft indicates she has a brain injury and although deft has not failed to come to court as ordered, she continues to commit crimes. The State asks the Court to deny bond modification.

BTC: bond modification is denied.

Defendant Ardie J Thomas in court with attorney Erin Joy Larsen.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.  Competency review. DAY TWO:
Jury Instruction conference.
Defense renews motion for mistrial.
BTC:  Motion denied.
Closing arguments.
Jury Instructions read.
Alternate juror chosen and excused.
Oath #3 given.
Jurors to deliberate 9:16 am.

COURT REPORTER:  KATIE GIEBEL.
Jurors indicate that they can't reach a unanimous decision and asks what they should do.
State req that Court give Allen instruction.
Defense moves for mistrial.
Jurors return at 1:11 and foreperson is questioned by Court re: decision.
Jurors excused.
BTC:  Finding that jurors are unable to reach a verdict.  Mistrial granted.  Jury trial scheduled for April 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ardie J Thomas in court with attorney Erin Joy Larsen.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Robin Anderson.
State gave defendant new offer.  Defendant rejected offer and req that Atty Larsen be removed from case.
BTC:  Motion to remove Atty Larsen is denied.
Jury pool enters courtroom.
Oath #1 given.
Voir Dire.
Final jurors selected, unselected jurors excused.
Defense stipulates to Miranda issue.
Court conducts colloquy w/ defendant.
BTC:  Finding that defendant freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives her right to a Miranda/Goodchild hearing.
Oath #2 given.
Preliminary Instructions read.
Opening statements.
State calls Officer R. Sieds, DSAT.
State calls Officer P. Danowski, DSAT.
Ex. 1 offered.  BTC:  Rec'd.
State calls D.C., DSAT.
Ex. 3&6 offered.  BTC:  Rec'd.
State calls T.S., DSAT.
Ex. 4&5 offered.  BTC:  Rec'd.
Defense moves for mistrial.
BTC:  Motion denied.
Court conducts colloquy with defendant re: right to testify.
BTC:  Finding that defendant freely, voluntarily and knowingly agrees to testify.
State calls M. Stardy, DSAT.
Ex. 2 offered.  BTC:  Rec'd.
State rests.
Defense calls Ardie Thomas, DSAT.
Defense rests.
Defense moves to dismiss.
BTC:  Finding that there is sufficient evidence for a guilty.  Motion denied.
  Jury trial scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
